sec.p: As compared with Salm. Typhimurium ( Figure 3b), higher removal of Staph. aureus biofilms were achieved at 15 min exposure time for SNP-ZEO ( Figure 3a). Results demonstrated that biofilm of Staph. aureus is more sensitive to SNP - ZEO than Salm. Typhimurium. SNP at MIC, 2MIC, and 4MIC concentrations resulted in 93, 87 and 71.33% and 82, 79 and 58% removal of Staph. aureus and Salm. Typhimurium cells, respectively. For Staph. aureus and Salm. Typhimurium, 90.6%, and 89% bacteria were eliminated at a concentration of MIC for ZEO. Concerning the hydrophobicity property of ZEO, it can be observed in Figure 3, a reduction in the biofilm removal with increasing ZEO concentration supporting the use of surfactants could help in the disruption of such shortcoming.

div.p: The effect of silver nanoparticle (SNP) and Zataria multiflora essential oil (ZEO) on removal one-day old biofilm of Staph. aureus ( a) and Salm. Typhimurium ( b) developed on polystyrene surface with 15 min contact time. Different letters for each concentration of antimicrobial indicate a statistically significant difference ( P < 0.05).
